document.discussion_title: Appeal for witnesses after Radford assault
document.topic_text: Appeal for witnesses after Radford assault May 10, 2016 Send by email Nottinghamshire Police were called to an incident in Radford, at around 5pm today (10 May 2016) following an assault. Two men carried out the assault whilst the 21-year-old victim was sat in his car – a silver Vauxhall Corsa. The assault took place outside Bargain Booze in Ilkeston Road. The two men suspected of being responsible for the attack were seen to flee the scene on a black car. The 21-year-old man was taken by ambulance to hospital with injuries to his leg and hands. The injuries are believed to have been caused by a knife or other bladed article but are not believed to be life-threatening or life-altering. Officers are investigating and are urging anyone with who witnessed the incident, saw a black car leaving the scene or anyone who has any information to call Nottinghamshire Police on 101 quoting incident number 600 of 10 May 2016.
